According to media reports, a total of 78 students have been placed during Women's Christian College placements 2023. Further, the salary package offered during Women's Christian College placements 2023 stood between INR 4.30 LPA and INR 8.5 LPA

• No. of students placed :78
  • Salary package range:INR 4.30 LPA to INR 8.5 LPA
  • No. of companies visited :8

Elective courses:

  • NME List

Scholarship :

  • Central Government Scholarship :

    Post Matric Minority Scholarship This scholarship is offered by the Central Government to students belonging to minority communities like Muslims, Sikhs, Jains, Christians etc. Scholarship is offered based on the income of the parents. Announcements are made by the Government through an advertisement in the newspaper. Students can apply online through the National Scholarship portal (NSP).

  • Government of Tamil Nadu :
    Shift 1:
    SC/ ST Scholarship
    BC/ MBC/ de-notified communities Scholarship

    Shift 2
    SC/ ST Scholarship
  • Management Scholarship:
    Management scholarship is a merit cum means scholarship and it is sanctioned based on the recommendations of the department and discretion of the Principal.
  • Scranton Scholarship
  • Blue Oval Scholarship

Attendance :
The working hours of the College for SHIFT-1 are from 08.00 am to 01.20 pm SHIFT-2 are from 12:30 pm to 05:30 pm. Students are required to be punctual and regular to class.Attendance will be taken every hour of classes.Above 55% is required to attend End Semester Examination ,if the students fails to attain the required percentage has to pay condonation of attendance.

Condonation of Attendance :
Detailed written requests supported by relevant data should be submitted to the Principal for condonation of lack of attendance to appear for the End of Semester Examinations. The Principalâ€™s decision will be final.
Condonations can be paid by students whose attendance are lacking

Academics :
A student has to earn compulsory credits for Value Education,Physical Education & Extension Activities to qualify for a degree.
Students participating in co-curricular and extra-curricular activities in college / university programs should submit duly signed leave requests in advance failing which they will be marked absent.

Value Education :
  1. Scripture : An organized study of the Bible is offered to all Christian students. Students can choose either CEC (Christian Educational Council) or TAFTEE (The Association for Theological Education by Extension) which earns them one credit per year in their Academic Curriculum.
  2. Holistic Value Education : Holistic Value Education is offered to all Non-Christian students.This course earns them one credit per year in their Academic Curriculum.
  3. Physical Education :A student has to compulsorily participate in physical fitness activities offered by the department during the first year as a part of her course requirement.
    4. 0
  4. Outreach Education :Extension activities are a compulsory part of the curriculum, to inculcate in the students, and awareness of their role in the community and the needs of the less privileged.

safety in Chennai's Women's Christian College, the institution has deployed female security guards on its campus.Ragging in any form is strictly prohibited on campus. Students who are directly or indirectly involved in ragging will be punished as per the Government rules. Incidents of ragging should be reported to the Principal immediately and written complaints may be dropped in a Black Box available at the Principal's Office.
